job_title: Academic Affairs Assistant in Columbia, SC
pros: Get to work with the VP of the college and get many opportunities brought to you. Flexible with my school’s schedule, easy job.
cons: There’s no cons. I really enjoy this job

job_title: Electrical Engineer Student in Columbia, SC
pros: Good quality of education, professional, and historical.
cons: Poor dorms, poor facilities, and the food

review_title: Great beginning of a career in STEM, but very temporary.
pros: Convenience is an incentive if one lives in the Columbia area. If you are an alumni it is a great possibility that you can be hired if you know someone with in administration.
cons: There is a lot of nepotism and politics within this institution. Responsibilities are not distributed fairly and grant money is abused by obligations beyond the sponsored programs that are originally rewarded. Administration is very slow to distribute pay and the integrity of faculty educating students is at risk due to the load of responsibilities that are given, overtime is not given and majority of the time one has to arrive before school hours and stay after work hours.

pros: Getting to help young people achieve their goals and working with colleagues to make the college a better place for the future.
cons: No pay increases over the past 10 years, and opportunity for growth is not here for those interested in moving up.

pros: College student, great experience. Learned a lot from my professors, enjoyed the life as a college student and working student.
cons: Not really any cons, I was a college student trying to earn money

pros: people easy to get along with, alot of holidays off
